metadata.title: CVE-2018-11712 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
WebCore/platform/network/soup/SocketStreamHandleImplSoup.cpp in the libsoupnetwork backend of WebKit, as used in WebKitGTK+ versions 2.20.0 and2.20.1, failed to perform TLS certificate verification for WebSocketconnections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.20.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.20.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.20.2-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.20.2-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.2-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
